title: Doubutsu Kei Style Chintan
steps: Blanch the pork neck bones briefly by covering them with cold water in a pot, bringing them to a boil, and cooking for 15-20 minutes, or until the scum subsides. Strain the bones and reserve.
Add neck bones and chicken backs to new water in a stockpot, bring to a simmer, and skim any scum that rises, for around 5-10 minutes.
Reduce heat back down to below simmer (around 88°C/190°F), hold for 7 hours (additional time to account for the pork bones).
Add your onion, garlic, and ginger. Cook for an additional hour.
Strain the soup and hold until needed.
notes: This recipe combines chicken and pork products to produce a more round amino acid profile.
Lighter in body, this soup is excellent in Miso and also good with shoyu applications.
Blanching the pork neck bones helps remove myoglobin and preserve clarity (optional).
Can use all chicken backs or all pork bones if desired.
From 'The Book of Ramen' - Chapter 2: Soup
